sentences.chinese: 漢亦一家之事，典法不傳，謂子孫何？
sentences.literal: Han also one family's matter, classical laws not transmitted, what tell descendants?

sentences.chinese: 化隆者閎博，治淺者褊狹，可不勉與！」
sentences.literal: Transformation flourishing ones vast broad, governance shallow ones narrow cramped, can not strive with them!"

sentences.chinese: 乃以太初之元改正朔，易服色，封太山，定宗廟百官之儀，以為典常，垂之於後云。
sentences.literal: Then with Tai Chu's origin corrected calendar, changed garment colors, sealed Taishan, established ancestral temple hundred officials' ceremonies, as classical constant, handed down to posterity cloud.

sentences.chinese: 人生有欲，欲而不得則不能無忿，忿而無度量則爭，爭則亂。
sentences.literal: Human life has desires, desire and not obtain then cannot without resentment, resentment and without measure then contend, contend then chaos.

sentences.chinese: 先王惡其亂，故制禮義以養人之欲，給人之求，使欲不窮於物，物不屈於欲，二者相待而長，是禮之所起也。
sentences.literal: Former kings hated their chaos, therefore established rites righteousness to nourish people's desires, supply people's requests, make desires not exhaust in things, things not bend to desires, two things mutually await and grow, this is rites' origin.
Rice millet five flavors, thus nourish mouth also;
Pepper orchid fragrant chai, thus nourish nose also;
Bells drums pipes strings, thus nourish ears also;
Carved engraved patterns writings, thus nourish eyes also;

sentences.chinese: 疏房床笫几席，所以養體也：故禮者養也。
sentences.literal: Spacious rooms beds mats tables mats, thus nourish body also: therefore rites are nourishment.

sentences.chinese: 君子既得其養，又好其辨也。
sentences.literal: Superior man already obtained its nourishment, moreover likes its distinction.

sentences.chinese: 所謂辨者，貴賤有等，長少有差，貧富輕重皆有稱也。
sentences.literal: What is called distinction, noble base have ranks, elder younger have differences, poor rich light heavy all have proportion.

sentences.chinese: 故天子大路越席，所以養體也；
sentences.literal: Therefore Son of Heaven great carriage rush mats, thus nourish body also;
